result.execSummary:
All charges against Richard W. Sotka in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard W. Sotka is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Transfer Another's Personal Property (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000)

11:32 AM Court calls 22CF8, 22CF33, 21CM104 and 21CM177 Defendant Richard W. Sotka in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Defendant Richard W. Sotka in custody.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  22CF8 and 22CF33 PH - State calls N.B. who is sworn and testifies.  Cross exam by Defense.  State calls TC who is sworn & testifies.  State's Exhibit# 2 offered & rec'd.  Cross exam by Defense.  Court questions Deft.  Redirect by State.  State's Exhibit 1 & 3 offered & rec'd.    22CF8 Probable cause found after preliminary hearing. Defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd. 22CF33 - Court does not find Probable cause.  Court dismisses case.  Arraignment scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 09:00 am. Defendant Richard W. Sotka in court with attorney Timothy DeBord.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

to include both 22CF8 and 22CF33 w/conditions   Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.  Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/T.C., N.B.   Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.  GPS if bond is posted.

Bond in the new filing will be the same as 22CF8.  Bond to be addressed on 3/4 at 11:30.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
